script: THE NEW FASCIST REGIME.
MILITARY POSTS ARE ESTABLISHED TO EXTERMINATE THE RESISTANCE.
A long time ago, in the Underground Realm, where there are no lies or pain, there lived a princess who dreamt of the human world.
She dreamt of blue skies, soft breeze, and sunshine.
One day, eluding her keepers, the princess escaped.
Once outside, the bright sun blinded her and erased her memory.
She forgot who she was and where she came from.
Her body suffered cold, sickness, and pain.
However, her father, the king, always knew that the Princess' soul would return, perhaps in another body, in another place, at another time.
He would wait for her until he drew his last breath, until the world stopped turning.
Why did you bring so many books, Ofelia?
We're going to the country, the outdoors.
Fairy tales?
You're a bit old to be filling your head with such nonsense.
Ask him to stop the car.
Ofelia, wait.
Your brother's not well.
Madam, are you okay?
Madam, do you need anything?
Water. Water for the captain's wife.
Come on!
Ofelia?
Ofelia, come here.
-I saw a fairy. -Just look at your shoes!
Let's go.
When we get there, come out to greet the Captain.
I want you to call him Father.
You have no idea how good he's been to us.
It's just a word, Ofelia.
They're coming, Captain.
They're 15 minutes late.
Carmen.
Welcome.
Please, don't. I can walk perfectly well.
The doctor says you must not exert yourself.
No.
Come on.
Do it for me.
Thank you.
Ofelia, come out.
Say hello to the Captain.
Ofelia.
It's the other hand, Ofelia.
Mercedes!
-Bring the luggage. -Yes, sir.
It's a labyrinth.
A pile of old rocks that's always been here even before the mill.
You better not go in there. You might get lost.
Thank you.
Have you read them all?
Mercedes!
The Captain is calling for you.
Your father needs me.
He's not my father.
The Captain is not my father.
My father was a tailor. He died in the war.
The Captain is not my father.
You've made that clear enough. Shall we go?
Have you seen my mother?
-Isn't she beautiful? -Yes.
The baby is making her sick. Have you noticed?
The guerrillas are deep in the woods. It's hard to track them.
The scum knows the terrain better than us.
We'll block their access.
We'll store food, medicine, and everything else here.
That way, they will come to us.
We'll set up three new command posts.
Here, here, and here.
Mercedes.
-Ask Dr. Ferreiro to come down. -Yes, sir.
This will help you sleep.
Just drink two drops before bed.
Two drops only.
Thank you.
All of it. Good.
Don't hesitate to call me any time of the day.
You or your nurse.
Good night.
Close the door and turn off the lights.
You have to go up and see him there.
His leg wound is getting worse.
This is all I could get.
I'm sorry.
Captain Vidal is waiting in his office.
Come here, Ofelia.
My gosh, your feet are ice-cold.
Are you afraid?
A little.
What's that noise?
Nothing, it's just the wind.
Nights here are different from city nights.
There, you hear cars and trains.
Here, the houses are old.
They creak… as if they are speaking.
Tomorrow, I'll give you a surprise.
A surprise?
-Is it a book? -No. It's something much better.
Why did you have to get married?
I was alone too long.
I'm with you. You weren't alone.
You were never alone.
When you're older, you'll understand. It's been hard for me too.
Your brother's acting up.
Tell him one of your stories.
I'm sure that will calm down.
My brother… Many, many years ago, in a sad, faraway land, there was an enormous mountain made of rough, black stone.
At sunset, on top of that mountain, a magic rose blossomed that would make whoever plucked it immortal.
But no one dared to go near it because its thorns were full of poison.
Men talked amongst themselves about their fear of death and pain… but never about the promise of eternal life.
And every day, the rose wilted, unable to bequeath its gift to anyone.
forgotten and lost at the top of that cold, dark mountain, forever alone until the end of time.
Come in.
-How is she? -Very weak.
She'll have rest.
I'll sleep down here.
-And my son? -Sir?
Excuse us, Captain.
My son, how is he?
There's no reason to be alarmed.
Very good.
Captain, your wife shouldn't have traveled at such a late stage of pregnancy.
-Is that your opinion? -My professional opinion, yes, sir.
A son should be born where his father is.
That's all.
One more thing, Captain.
What makes you so sure the baby is a male?
Don't fuck with me.
We detected movement in the northwest sector at 8:00 p.m.
Gunfire.
Sergeant Bayona searched the area and captured a suspect.
The other one's his son.
Captain, my father is an honorable man.
Let me judge that. Take your hat off in front of me.
We found this weapon on him. It's been fired.
My father was hunting rabbits.
Again, keep quiet.
No God, no country, no Master?
-How do you like that? -Red propaganda, Captain.
It's not propaganda, sir.
It's an old almanac, Captain.
We're just farmers.
Go on.
I went up into the woods to hunt for rabbits, Captain.
They're for my sick daughters.
Rabbits, uh?
Captain, if my father says so, he was hunting rabbits.
Leave him alone.
You killed him!
You're a murderer, you son of a bitch!
Search these assholes properly before you come bothering me.
Yes, Captain.
Mother.
Mother, wake up.
Mother, there's something in the room.
Hello.
Did you follow me here?
Are you a fairy?
Look.
This is a fairy.
You want me to go with you?
Outside? Where?
Hello?
Hello?
Echo.
Echo.
Hello?
Hello?
It's you?
It's you. You've returned.
Don't be frightened, I beg you.
Look.
My name is Ofelia. Who are you?
Me?
Me.
I've had so many names, old names that only the wind and the trees can pronounce.
I am the mountain, the forest, and the earth.
I am… I am a faun.
-Your most humble servant, Your Highness. -No, I'm-- You're Princess Moanna, daughter of the king of the underworld.
My father was a tailor.
You are not born of man.
It was the moon that bore you.
If you look at your left shoulder, you will find a mark that proves it.
Your real father had us open portals all over the world to allow your return.
This is… the last of them.
But we have to make sure that your essence is intact, that you have not become a mortal.
You must complete three tasks before the moon is full.
This is The Book of Crossroads.
Open it when you are alone, and it will show you your future and what must be done.
But there's nothing.
Mercedes, prepare these rabbits for dinner tonight.
They are too young.
-See if they'll do for a stew. -Yes, sir.
This coffee was burnt. Taste it yourself.
You should keep an eye on it.
As you wish, sir.
Cook these.
-He hated the coffee. -He's so damn fussy!
-A fussy dandy! -We need more beef and chicken.
Where will we find it?
The doctor's wife and the mayor are coming.
They eat more than a couple of pigs.
-And they don't shut up. -Not even underwater.
Mercedes, I'll be back in a moment.
Ofelia.
Your father is throwing a dinner tonight.
Look what I've made for you.
Do you like it?
What I wouldn't have given to have such a dress as fine as this when I was your age.
And look at these shoes.
-Do you like them? -Yes, they're very pretty.
Go on, now. Take a bath.
ARBOR THE ANIMALS, MEN, AND WOMEN ALL SLEEP TOGETHER UNDER THE SHADOW OF A TREE NEAR THE WINDMILL.
Ofelia?
Ofelia?
Hurry up. I want to see the dress on you.
You must look lovely for the Captain.
You'll look like a princess.
A princess?
Clean those chickens properly.
And don't forget the beans.
-You look marvelous, my girl. -You're beautiful.
Get back to work. Stop wasting time.
Do you want some milk?
Move back, don't get your dress dirty. You look so pretty.
Mercedes. Do you believe in fairies?
No.
I did when I was little, but I believed in a lot of things.
Last night, a fairy visited me.
Really?
Yes, and there were three of them.
-There was a faun too. -A faun?
He was very old, very tall, and smelled like earth.
My mother warned me to be wary of fauns.
Mercedes!
Come with me.
-The provisions. -Yes, they finally arrived.
Wait.
Captain, everything is here.
Flour, salt, oil, medicine, olives, bacon.
Tobacco.
And the ration cards.
-You must check the inventory. -Very well.
Mercedes.
-The key. -Yes, sir.
-Is this the only copy? -Yes, it's the only one.
From now on, I'll carry it.
Captain.
Captain, perhaps it's nothing.
It's them.
Once upon a time, when the forest was young, it was home to creatures who were full of magic and wonder.
They protected one another, and slept in the shade of a large fig tree that grew on a hill near the mill.
But now, the tree is dying.
Its branches are dry, and its trunk old and twisted.
A monstrous toad has settled in its roots and won't let the tree thrive.
Force the magic stones into the toad's mouth and take the golden key from inside its belly.
Only then will the fig tree flourish again.
They were here only minutes ago.
They left in a hurry.
A dozen men, at most.
Antibiotics.
Shit, they forgot this lottery ticket.
They're here.
Those sons of bitches are here, and they're watching us.
Hey!
You left this behind!
And your lottery ticket!
Why don't you come back and get it?
Who knows? This could be your lucky day!
I'm Princess Moanna, and I'm not afraid of you.
Aren't you ashamed living down here, eating all these bugs, and growing fat while the tree dies?
Have you checked in the pantry and the wine cellar?
Yes, madam.
Have you checked the garden?
-And the barn? -Yes, ma'am.
Where has she run off to?
This way, please.
Let me introduce you to my wife, Carmen.
-Nice to meet you. -A pleasure to meet you.
From now on, we'll have one ration card per family.
Take a look.
-One? -Only one.
Captain, I'm not sure it'll be enough.
If people are careful-- We can't allow anyone to send food to the guerillas.
They're losing ground, and one of them is wounded.
Excuse me, Captain. How can you be so sure?
We almost got them. We found this.
Antibiotics.
God has already taken care of their souls.
Their bodies hardly matter to Him.
We'll help however we can, Captain.
We know you're not here by choice.
You're wrong about that.
I want my son to be born in a new, cleansed Spain.
Because these people hold the mistaken belief that we're all equal.
But there's a big difference: the war is over and we won.
And if we need to kill every one of them, then we'll kill them all, and that's that.
We're all here by choice.
-By choice! -By choice!
Put the coffee on. I'm going for more wood.
We'll take care of it.
Ofelia?
How did you and the Captain meet?
Ofelia's father used to make the Captain's uniforms.
Oh, I see.
And after he died, I went to work at the shop.
A little more than a year ago, the Captain and I met again.
Amazing, isn't it?
I mean, finding each other again?
Oh, yes, so amazing.
Please, forgive my wife. She isn't used to company.
She thinks her silly stories interest us all.
We understand.
Madam, they have found the girl.
Excuse me.
Have I told you I met your father?
No. I had no idea.
I met him in Morocco.
It was only brief, but he left a vivid impression.
He's an excellent soldier.
General Vidal's men said that before he died on the battlefield, he smashed his watch so his son would know the exact hour of his death.
So he'd know how a brave man dies.
Nonsense. He didn't own a watch.
What you've done hurts me.
After your bath, you'll go to bed without supper.
Are you listening?
Sometimes, I think you'll never learn to behave.
You've disappointed me, Ofelia.
You've disappointed your father too.
Do you mean the Captain?
Him more than me.
I've got the key.
Take me to the Labyrinth.
Hello.
I got the key out.
That's me, and the girl is you.
And the baby?
So you retrieved the key.
I'm glad.
She believed in you from the very beginning.
She's so glad you succeeded.
Keep the key.
You'll be needing it very soon.
You'll be needing this piece of chalk too.
Two tasks remain, and the moon is almost full.
Be patient.
We'll soon be strolling through the seven circular gardens of your palace.
Why would I believe you?
Why would a poor little faun like me lie to you?
Proceed.
Have your cards ready for inspection.
Let's go. Your name?
Sofía Agravios.
Your name?
Narciso Pena Soriano at your service.
Your name?
Our daily bread in Franco's Spain kept safe in this mill!
The Reds lie because in a united Spain, there's not a single home without fire or bread.
Come on, show me what happens now.
Show me.
Help!
Ofelia!
Ofelia… Ofelia, help me.
Our daily bread in Franco's Spain. The bread we stored in our barn.
Captain!
Commies lie when they say there is hunger in Spain.
Come quickly.
…because in a united Spain, there's not a single home without fire or bread.
Our daily bread in Franco's Spain.
Your wife needs uninterrupted rest.
She will have to be sedated most of the time.
The girl should sleep somewhere else.
I'll stay until she gives birth.
Make her well.
I'll pay whatever it costs and give whatever you need.
Make her well.
Don't worry.
Your mother will get better soon, you'll see.
Having a baby is complicated.
Then I'll never have one.
You're helping the men in the woods, aren't you?
Have you told anyone?
No, I haven't.
I don't want anything to happen to you.
Nor I to you.
Do you know a lullaby?
Only one.
But I don't remember the words.
I don't care. I still want to hear it.
Don't be afraid. It's only me.
-Are you ready? -Yes.
Then let's go.
This is sheer madness.
When he finds out about us, he'll kill us all.
-Have you thought about that? -Are you so afraid of him, doctor?
I'm not.
At least not for myself.
Pedro!
Pedro, my brother.
You didn't carry out the task.
No, my mother is sick.
That's no excuse for negligence.
Look, this is a mandrake root, a plant that dreamt of being human.
Put it under your mother's bed in a bowl of fresh milk.
Each morning, give it two drops of blood.
We have no time to waste now.
The full moon will be upon us.
Take my pets to guide you through.
You're going to a very dangerous place, so be careful.
The thing that sleeps there… is not human.
You will see a sumptuous feast.
But don't eat or drink anything, absolutely nothing.
Your life depends on it.
I've brought some Orujo, tobacco, and cheese.
Mail for Trigo and Piloto.
Powder for lice.
Let's see how that leg's doing.
How do you think it's doing? It's fucked up.
Let's see.
North American, British, and Canadian troops disembarked on a small beach in the North of F… -It's France, you idiot. -France.
More than 150,000 soldiers give us hope under the command of General Dwight D. Eisenhower… Is it really bad, doctor?
Look, Frenchie.
There's no way to save it.
I'll do as few cuts as possible.
Wait for a second, doctor.
Just a second.
Use the chalk to trace a door anywhere in your room.
Once the door's open, start the hourglass.
Let the fairies guide you.
Don't eat or drink anything and come back before the last grain of sand falls.
No.
This one.
No!
We'll soon have reinforcements.
Fifty men or more. Then we'll go head to head with Vidal.
And then what?
If you kill him, they'll send another just like him and another.
You're screwed. You have no guns, no safe shelter.
You need food and medicine. You must take care of Mercedes.
If you love her, take her away.
-This is a lost cause. -I'm staying, doctor.
That's it.
You have to leave.
Here's the key, but you can't go down there now.
It's exactly what he expects.
Leave it to me.
I'm a coward.
No, you're not.
Yes, I am.
I'm a coward for living with that son of a bitch, doing his laundry, making his bed, and feeding him.
What if the doctor's right?
We'll make things harder for that bastard.
Left!
Captain Vidal.
I don't understand, her temperature's down.
But she still has a fever?
It's a good sign. Her body's fighting.
Listen to me.
If you have to choose, save the baby.
That boy will bear my name, my father's name.
Save him.
Brother.
Little brother.
If you can hear me, I want you to know that things out here aren't too good.
You'll have to come out soon.
You've made Mother very sick.
I want to ask you one favor for when you come out.
Just one.
Don't hurt her.
You'll meet her, she's very pretty.
She's sad for some days though.
But when she smiles, you'll love her.
Listen, if you do what I say, I'll make you a promise.
I'll take you back to my kingdom, and I'll make you a prince.
I promise you, a prince.
I sounded the whistle, but they wouldn't move.
I tried to stop, but it was too late.
We jumped out just in time, but look at the mess!
What did they steal?
They took nothing.
What the hell are you saying?
They just made a mess. They didn't open any wagon.
-They didn't take anything. -Nothing? Are you sure?
They were just trying to waste our time.
They came out of nowhere, Captain.
They have grenades, they're coming from uphill.
We've surrounded one unit that fell behind.
They took cover up on the hill.
Go ahead, Serrano, don't be afraid.
This is the only decent way to die.
Serrano!
Let me see.
Can you talk?
Damn it!
They are useless. One alive… Captain, this one's still alive.
He's only shot in the leg.
-What is it? -They caught one.
They're taking him to the storeroom.
Mercedes!
Pedro… Mercedes?
-I need to get into the storeroom. -Not now.
Move away!
That's plenty, dear.
Should I take this up?
Here, it's just half the dose.
I don't think I need it.
I feel better, much better.
I don't understand how, but I'm glad.
Mother… Damn, this cigarette is good!
Good-quality tobacco is really hard to find.
Fuck you.
The one we caught turns out to be a stutterer.
We'll be here all night.
As long as he talks.
Garces is right.
You're going to tell us everything, right?
I brought along a few tools to make sure that happens.
At first, I won't trust you.
But after I use this, you'll own up to a few things.
When we get to these, we'll have developed… How can I put this? A bond almost like brothers.
You'll see.
And when we get to this one, I'll believe anything you tell me.
I'll make you a deal.
If you can count to three without stuttering, you can go.
Don't look at him, look at me.
There's no one above me.
-Garces! -Yes, Captain?
If I say this asshole can go, would anybody contradict me?
No one, Captain. He can leave.
There you have it. Count to three.
-One. -Good.
Two.
One more, and you will be free.
Three… Too bad.
Your mother is much better, Your Highness.
You must be relieved.
Yes, thank you.
But things haven't turned out so well.
They haven't?
-I had an accident. -An accident?
Yes.
-You broke the rules! -I only ate two grapes!
I thought no one would notice.
-We've made a mistake! -A mistake?
You failed. You can never return.
-It was an accident! -You cannot return.
The moon will be full in three days.
Your spirit shall forever remain among humans.
You shall age like them, and you shall die like them.
All memory of you shall fade in time, and we'll vanish along with it.
You will never see us again.
Good day, doctor.
Sorry to wake you so early, but I think we need your help.
My God, what have you done to him?
Not much.
But things are getting better.
I like having you here, doctor.
It has its advantages.
Serrano, stay here.
I talked.
Not much.
-But I talked. -I'm sorry.
I'm so sorry.
Kill me. Kill me now, please.
Son of a bitch.
It'll take away the pain.
It's almost over.
Keep an eye on the doctor, -I'll be there in a minute. -Yes, Captain.
You're not moving anymore.
Are you sick?
What are you doing down there?
-Call him! -Who?
Who else, you imbecile? Ferreiro!
What the hell is this?
-No! -Leave her. Leave her alone, please!
Look what she was hiding under your bed.
What do you think of this?
What is this thing doing under the bed?
It's a magic root the faun gave me.
It's all that junk that you let her read.
Look what you've done!
Please, leave us alone. I'll talk to her, darling.
Fine.
As you wish.
He told me you would get better, and you did.
Ofelia, you have to listen to your father.
You have to stop all this.
No. I want to leave this place!
Please, take me away from here!
-Please! -Things are not that simple.
You're getting older, so you'll see that life isn't like your fairy tales.
The world is a cruel place.
You'll learn that even if it hurts.
-No! -Ofelia!
Magic does not exist. Not for you, me, or anyone else.
Mom! Help!
Help!
Help!
Why did you do it?
It was the only thing I could do.
No. You could have obeyed me.
I could have, but I didn't.
It would have been better for you.
I don't understand. Why didn't you obey me?
To obey like that, for the sake of obeying, without questioning.
Only people like you can do that, Captain.
Captain!
Garces! Call the troop paramedic.
-Tell him to come immediately! -Yes, Captain.
Your wife is dead.
Because the paths to the Lord are inscrutable.
And the essence of His forgiveness lies in His word and in His mystery.
Because although God sends us the message, it is our task to decipher it.
Far away now is the soul in its eternal glory.
The earth takes in only a hollow, and a senseless shell… and the state of grace that we lose at our birth.
Because God, in His infinite wisdom, puts the solution in our hands.
And because only in His physical absence… is the place He occupies in our souls is reaffirmed.
You knew Dr. Ferreiro pretty well, didn't you, Mercedes?
We all knew him, sir.
Everyone around here.
The stutterer spoke of an informer who is here at the mill.
Can you imagine? Right under my nose.
Mercedes, please.
What do you think of me?
You must think I'm some kind of a monster.
It doesn't matter what someone like me thinks, sir.
Go to the storeroom and bring me more liquor.
Yes, sir. Goodnight, sir.
Mercedes.
Are you forgetting something?
Sir?
The key.
I have the only copy, don't I?
Yes, sir.
You know, there's an odd detail that's been bothering me.
Maybe it's not important, but when they broke into the storeroom with all those grenades and explosives, the lock wasn't forced open.
As I said, it's probably not important.
Be very careful.
Good night, sir.
Ofelia!
Ofelia, I'm leaving tonight.
-Where to? -I can't tell you. I can't tell you… -Take me with you. -No. I can't.
I can't, my child. But I'll come back for you, I promise.
Take me with you.
I heard something.
It's nothing, don't worry.
Mercedes.
Ofelia.
How long have you known?
How long have you been mocking me, you little bitch?
Watch her!
And if anyone tries to get in, kill her first.
Dry meat.
Tobacco.
Had you asked, I would have given this to you.
I want the names of those who wrote these letters.
I want them in front of me tomorrow.
Yes, Captain.
You can go, Garces.
Are you sure, Captain?
For God's sake, she's just a woman.
That's what you've always thought.
That's how I got away with it.
I was invisible to you.
Damn.
You've found my weakness, pride.
But it's your weak points we're interested in.
It's very simple, you will talk.
And I have to know if it's true.
We have a few things here strictly for that purpose.
It's not complicated.
These are things we learn on the job.
At first… I'm not some old man or a wounded prisoner, you motherfucker.
Don't you dare touch the girl.
You won't be the first pig I gutted.
Hey!
Look! He let her go.
The fuck did you say?
Hey!
Get her! Come on! Bring her to me!
Bring her to me, damn it!
Mount up!
It'll be better if you come without struggling.
The Captain said that if you behave… Don't be a fool, sweetheart.
If anyone's going to kill you… I rather it'd be me.
I've decided to give you one last chance.
Do you promise to do what I say?
Will you do everything I tell you without question?
This is your last chance.
Listen to me.
Fetch your brother and bring him to the labyrinth as quickly as you can, Your Highness.
-My brother? -We need him.
-But-- -No more questions.
The door's locked.
In that case, create your own door.
Captain, permission to speak.
Come quickly.
-Now what? -Serrano is back. He's wounded.
Wounded?
Where's Garces?
How many were there?
I don't know exactly, Captain.
There were at least 50 men.
The others didn't make it. Our watch posts are not responding.
-How many men we have left? -Around 20. Maybe less, sir.
We're leaving.
Together.
Don't be afraid.
Nothing will happen to you.
Safeguard the perimeter.
If the rest of the squad gets back, report immediately to me.
Yes, Captain.
Leave him!
Ofelia!
Quickly, Your Majesty.
Give him to me.
The full moon is high in the sky.
We can open the portal.
Why is that in your hand?
The portal will only open if we offer the blood of an innocent.
Just a drop of blood, that's all.
It's the final task.
Hurry.
You promised to obey me!
-Give me the boy! -No!
My brother stays with me.
You would give up your sacred rights for this brat you barely know?
Yes, I would.
You would give up your throne for him?
He who has caused you such misery, such humiliation?
Yes, I would.
As you wish, Your Highness.
No!
My son.
Tell my son… Tell him what time his father died.
-Tell him that I-- -No.
He won't even know your name.
Arise, my daughter.
Come.
Father.
You have spilled your own blood rather than that of an innocent.
That was the final and the most important task.
And you chose well, Your Highness.
Come here with me, and sit by your father's side.
He's been waiting for you so long.
It is said the princess returned to her father's kingdom.
That she reigned there with justice and a kind heart for many centuries.
That she was loved by her people.
And that she left behind small traces of her time on earth, visible only to those who know where to look.
